job_title: Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist in Lewiston, ME
pros: Leadership is motivated by doing the right thing, meeting unmet community needs, taking care of clients and staff while maintaining financial sustainability.
cons: Operates in a challenging financial environment.

review_title: they really don't care that you're paid poverty wages
pros: Good supervision in the clinical department
cons: I have a master's degree and an independent license and my supervisor seemed to not give a damn that i qualify for low income housing based on my wages.

pros: good job environment and fun work

job_title: Home Health Coordinator in Lewiston, ME
cons: Lack of communication between support staff, upper management, and direct care workers.

pros: Supportive work culture at Tri County
cons: Pay is extremely low for level of education required and years of experience

review_title: Loved it! Would go back in an instant!
pros: Great benefits, supervisor and team support, excellent training opportunities
cons: Redundant case-loads that could become very overwhelming. Not the best pay for the amount of work we do between Direct service hours and the paperwork

review_title: Best Company I Ever Worked For
job_title: Employment Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great staff, open door policy, great team work, good communication, great PTO, hands on management, room to grow, promote from within, great training, no micromanaging.

review_title: Overall it was an ok place to work, the clinical staff are great it is management that has the problem.
pros: The clinical staff are well educated and top-notch.  The support staff are very friendly and helpful.  The services offered are fairly comprehensive.
cons: The management team including executive team, Human Resources, and Mid-level management.  There is a major disconnect between clinical staff and management.

pros:
The agency helps people with severe mental illness. 
The work makes a difference.
It used to be a great place to work.
cons: The agency eliminated effective programs and dumped long term clients.  There is no agency mission anymore.  They see front line staff as disposable.  Administration micromanages but then doesn't follow through.

review_title: Tri County Mental Health has transformed into the premier Behavioral Health organization In the country.
pros: In the past two years the agency has transformed its services to the best evidence based models in the US.   Tri County has also created a highly success integrate team based model.
cons: Need more quality people for this growing organization.

review_title: A great group of people to work with!
pros: Loved the co-workers that I had and the real care that employees had for each other.  Provided lots of opportunities for advancement.
cons: Senior Leadership sometimes struggled to manage during turbulent external environments, in part because clinical leadership didn't seem to have a clear vision.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Lewiston, ME
pros: Client focused, supportive atmosphere, lots of connections with colleagues.  Kind, motivated, and focused staff.  Work/ Life Balance is amazing.  Enjoyed going to work every day!
cons: I enjoyed going to work every day even with the typical stressors.  I felt supported.

review_title: This is a great place to work
pros: There is a very flexible work environment.
